Actually, one big philosophical question: is the intend to make the API public so that custom implementations can be done from outside the source tree ?

I hope to make this API public at some point down the road, but its not quite there right now.

I'd like to do a GRFC for that first, once gevent is supported.

It has the same goal as grpc/proposal#8, but attempts to reuse the existing libuv implementation as much as possible and decrease the internal API leakage as much as possible.

Right now, the API attempts to reduce the input to the implmentation needing to pass a BSD-style socket implementation only.  (Its built around TCP, but could be built around UDP instead).

The rough sketch of such an API is defined in the following files:
```
tcp_custom.h
resolve_address_custom.h
timer_custom.h
pollset_custom.h
 ```

Thanks for the review!

With regards to the API being too restrictive for a general event loop, I've gotten a working gevent (Python IOmanager) working with this abstraction without much difficulty (about 400 lines), which provides some validation for this level of abstraction.
